answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Shannon, 
At this time I wasn't able to find an example survey for how although I did find an article that discusses best practices for economic development and business surveys that you may find helpful. http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9305/public/cover.cfm?author=David%20Ammons%20and%20Jonathan%20Morgan&title=State-of-the-Art%20Measures%20in%20Economic%20Development&subtitle
I hope other local government officials are able to weigh in and help you create a survey for your business community. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Shannon Delaney
text:
Hello, 
I was wondering if anyone had examples of an economic development survey that is geared to new businesses (businesses that have been in the City for one year)? The purpose of the survey is to gauge the business' experience working in the City thus far and to see if the Economic Development Department can help in certain areas. 
Thank you, 
Shannon
title: Economic Development Surveys for New Businesses
